attributes.action: Routes to main schools should be assessed for safety of students.
attributes.additional_details: Students have had many close calls. Almost all of these happen at a duel carriage off/on round-a-bout. This must be crossed to get to the school or face a walk down a muddy and rocky bike track that is unsuitable. The school does not offer a bus route due to the range of the school.  As you start to walk across or start your bike a car would come out of nowhere due to high speed of the area and nearly strike us for no fault of our own. I am sure if you ask the effected they will back this up.
attributes.background: As a former attendee of John Port Spenser Academy, I had a daily commute to Etwall from Hilton. On the way there I have had many incidents and so have others. These are mainly involving cars not indicating when leaving a round-a-bout onto and off a duel carriage way.  There is no other way to walk.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because Derbyshire County Council are responsible for schools, roads and pedestrian access in your area, not the UK Government or Parliament. 

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. 

You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: 

https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors 

You could also start a petition to Derbyshire Council here:

https://www.derbyshire.gov.uk/council/have-your-say/petitions/petitions.aspx
